definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: Chapter IV illustrates China's reclassification of the difficulty of duty and the introduction of countermeasures.
sentences.chinese: 第四章闡敘了我國開徵遺產稅的難點及對策。

sentences.english: It is the middle class that will benefit most if we abolish estate duty.
sentences.chinese: 取消遺產稅後，最大的得益者是中產。

sentences.english: Respect for individual preferences does allow bequests to be taxed.
sentences.chinese: 尊重個人偏好的原則允許徵收遺產稅。

sentences.english: Negotiating the terms of the contract could be enough to secure the IHT relief.
sentences.chinese: 僅通過對合同條款的談判就足以達到免遺產稅。

sentences.english: On the form of securities transfers of property levy estate or gift tax.
sentences.chinese: 對以證券形式轉讓的財產徵收遺產稅或贈與稅。

sentences.english: Levying estate tax and income tax are considered to be goods tax.
sentences.chinese: 遺產稅和所得稅也被視爲貨物稅。

sentences.english: Estate Duty is a revenue in which estate leaved behind after the citizen's death.
sentences.chinese: 遺產稅是對公民死亡時遺留的財產課徵的稅收。

sentences.english: Exemption from estate duty to the future, Mr encountered trouble on it.
sentences.chinese: 爲了今後免交遺產稅，王先生就因此遇到了麻煩。

sentences.english: He inherited substantial property subtracted legacy tax.
sentences.chinese: 減去遺產稅，他繼承了富裕的財產。

definition: personal income tax (abbr. for 個人所得稅|个人所得税)
to pay/to hand over (tax payment etc)
